by Graham Williams

Section D CTAN Edition

Welcome to the XML based and XSL generated version of The TeX Catalogue Online, Section D CTAN Edition. This is a listing of entries in the TeX Catalogue and may take a little time to load, but is hopefully worth it. Have a look at the Catalogue Preface for alternative ways of accessing the catalogue.

The TeX Catalogue Online is also available from any CTAN node or mirror, including the following. Pick one that is close to you. (The "search" link attempts to find a CTAN node that may be close to you, courtesy of Randy Kobes. Multiple clicks may find alternatives.)



search

aarnet

switch

cstug

dante

loria

tex

roma

riken

gust

rge

ctan

Icons associated with many entries in the catalogue allow you to:

  • view the directory on CTAN
  • view documentation (possibly many)
  • view documentation in PDF format (requires the acroread plugin)
  • jump to the package's home page
  • download a gzip'd tar file from a nearby CTAN node (not supported by all nodes)
  • download a gzip'd tar file from ftp.dante.de

Other icons simply provide further information about the package:

  • part of the teTeX distribution
  • available on the TeX Live CD ROM

The license type, version (if known), and the date of the last change made to each particular Catalogue entry are also provided.

This compilation Copyright (c) 1998, 1999 Graham J. Williams. Last modified 1999/05/13.

Use of these web documents and information contained herein is subject to the CSIRO Legal Notice and Disclaimer.

dancers Font for the Sherlock Holmes `Dancing Men'.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
dante-src No caption.
Contains the source code for a TeX installation under UNIX (TeX, current release of \LateXe, MetaFont, BibTeX, MakeIndex, drivers for X11, HP LaserJet and PostScript).
license: unknown (1998/02/11)
dates Macros for parsing date strings.
license: unknown (1997/04/12)
dblfont No caption.
A package intended for generating commands that print letters in the blackboard-bold font (which is often used for the numerical sets, for example). See also bbm
license: lppl (1999/03/03)
dbprocess No caption.
Parse the output from a database, delimited by either a tab or comma, and apply a user-defined macro to each line.
license: unknown (1999/01/2)
dcolumn Align on the decimal point of numbers in tabulars.
See also warpcol
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
dcounter Supports dynamic counters.
Counters declared as dynamic are created at the time of their first use and they recieve at that moment the count style which was established by the \countstyle command. The special use of the \countstyle command with an optional parameter allows the modification of the subordination of existing counters.
license: unknown (1998/12/28)
default A style to help provide default parameters for TeX macros.
license: unknown (1998/07/18)
delarray No caption.
Add delimiters (parentheses etc.) around arrays (nesting brackets are automatically inserted).
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
deleq No caption.
Provides a more flexible numbering of equations, subequations, and `recycled' equations, including `partial' equation numbers (`3a', `3b', etc.).
license: unknown (1998/07/8)
delimtxt Read and parse text tables.
This experimental package can read and parse text tables delimited by user-defined tokens (e.g., tab). It can be used for serial letters and the like, making it easier to export the data file from MS-Excel/MS-Word
license: unknown (1999/03/30)
devanagari Fonts for typesetting Velthuis Devanagari.
See also dn2
license: unknown version: 2 (1998/12/7)
dialogl Macros for constructing interactive LaTeX scripts.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
dialogue Quote short scripted dialogue in LaTeX.
A LaTeX package defining the dialogue environment for citing short passages of scripted dialogue. See also blkcntrl moredefs relsize
license: gpl version: 1.1 1999/03/01 (1999/03/10)
dinbrief German letter DIN style.
See also akletter brief envlab formlett g-brief
license: nosell (1999/03/03)
directory No caption.
A package for LaTeX and BibTeX that facilitates the construction, maintenance and exploitation of an address book-like database.
license: unknown version: 1.00 (1998/03/10)
dn2 No caption.
A pre-processor to fix problems with using devanagari font with German language extensions.
license: unknown (1998/03/13)
doc Format LaTeX documentation.
Contains the definitions that are necessary to format the documentation of package files (Literate LaTeX) which incorporate both the documentation and the code.
license: unknown (1996/08/19)
docmfp Document non-LaTeX code.
Extends the doc package to cater for documenting non- code, such as MetaFont or , or even C code.
license: lppl (1999/04/15)
docstrip No caption.
Makes a package documentation file smaller by removing comments and other sections of the document conditionally.
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
dotlessj Generates a dot-less j.
license: lppl version: 1998/12/09 v0.03 (1999/04/15)
dotseqn Flush left equations with dotted letters to the numbers.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
doublespace No caption.
Defines the spacing environment which you can use anywhere in your document. This package is superseded by setspace .
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
doublestroke No caption.
A font based on Computer Modern Roman useful for typesetting the mathematical symbols for the natural numbers (N), whole numbers (Z), rational numbers (Q), real numbers (R) and complex numbers (C). See also blackboard
license: lppl version: 1.0 (1999/03/03)
draftcopy Identify draft copies.
Places the word DRAFT (or other words) in light grey diagonally across the background (or at the bottom) of each (or selected) pages of the document.
license: lppl version: 2.12 (1999/03/29)
drafthead No caption.
Prints a header on each page including date and time and the string DRAFT.
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
drama Production-style stage script in LaTeX.
A LaTeX package that defines macros for typesetting a basic production-style stage script. This package is useful but may have problems and is unsupported. See also abbrevs bits blkcntrl dialogue moredefs relsize
license: gpl version: 0.2 1996/05/05 (1999/03/10)
dratex General drawing macros entirely in TeX.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
drftcite No caption.
Print the tags instead of the numbers for \cite and \bibitem.
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
dropcaps Use dropped capitals to start a paragraph.
See also dropping
license: unknown (1996/06/19)
dropping No caption.
A LaTeX2e macro for dropping the first character(s) (or word(s)) of a paragraph, extending the LaTeX 2.09 package dropcaps and automatically taking care of finding the font name.
license: unknown (1998/07/9)
dstroke No caption.
Doublestroke font for typesetting the mathematical symbols for the natural numbers (N), whole numbers (Z), rational numbers (Q), real numbers (R) and complex numbers (C)
license: unknown (1999/03/31)
duerer Computer Duerer fonts.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
dvgtk No caption.
A DVI file previewer for Tektronix 4010 terminal emulators like Kermit, CONEX, or NCSA Telnet, using the Kpathsea library.
license: unknown (1997/04/29)
dvi2tty No caption.
A DVI driver to produce an ASCII representation of the document. The patch file dvi2tty.patch fixes a string termination bug which affects some systems (most notably Linux) and cleans up the Makefile.
license: unknown (1996/06/7)
dviconcat Concatenates dvi files.
license: unknown (1996/11/1)
dvicopy Copy and concatenate DVI files.
license: unknown (1996/11/1)
dvii Extract information from a DVI file.
A utility written in C that extracts information from a TeX dvi file. Information displayed can include a summary of File comment (usually the date file was compiled), file size, number of (physical) pages, and number of fonts. More detailed information can also be displayed, including font names for all fonts used, list of physical page number/TeX page number pairs, and a list of all \specials and the page on which they appear. To compile, you need to have a C compiler along with the standard C libraries (e.g., gcc on DOS or Unix).
license: lppl (1999/05/19)
dviljk No caption.
A dvi driver for the LaserJet printers with recursive file searching.
license: unknown (1998/04/6)
dvipaste No caption.
A program designed to produce files that conform to the TeX specifications for dvi files, even though they may actually be too big to be produced with normal implementations of TeX (because of limitations on memory size). More particularly, it allows the material appearing on individual pages of a `secondary' file to be inserted into a `main' file.
license: unknown (1998/02/23)
dvipdfm A dvi driver to produce PDF directly.
license: unknown version: 0.7.3 (1998/12/2)
dvips Tom Rokicki's dvi to PostScript driver.
See also dvipsk dvips-os2 dvips-shell
license: unknown (1997/05/13)
dvipsdoc No description available.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
dvipsk No caption.
A (now standard) version of dvips with support for recursive directory searching.
license: unknown version: 5.78 (1998/04/6)
dvips-os2 No caption.
OS/2 (and hence MS-DOS, MS-Windows3.1, MS-Windows32) executable for dvips .
license: unknown version: 5.83 (1999/01/21)
dvips-shell A dvips Shell for MS-Windows32.
license: unknown (1998/03/5)
